intro: Collaea, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rutaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray leaves, which are covered in fine, soft hairs, providing a unique visual appearance. Collaea species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various local wildlife species.
